bibl.title: The Account of Thoulis, King of Egypt, in the Chronographia of John Malalas.
bibl.note: John Malalas, Chron. 2, 2-3 (ed. J. Thurn, pp. 18-19). Thoulis is modeled on Sesostris, Osiris, and Alexander the Great and the narrative of his exploits alludes to the stories of these figures. The account as a whole seems to have been drafted to advance the Christian position on oracles, apparently by one Bouttios in the late fourth century. - Avec résumé en anglais.
